info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 8:25PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Louisa, southwestern Caroline and northwestern Hanover Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 825 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Montpelier, or 9 miles northeast of Goochland, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Montpelier around 835 PM EDT. Kings Dominion around 905 PM EDT. Ladysmith around 910 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Golansville, Oliver, Vontay, Gum Tree, Coatesville, Hewlett, Goodall, Doswell, Mabelton and Noel. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central and north central Virginia.
